input_text:
Job Title: Senior Lead Electronic Technician Installer with Security Clearance

Location: Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Position Summary MAG Aerospace is hiring for a Senior Lead Electronic Technician/Installer who will manage all installers, ensuring that all work/installs are completed to specification and on schedule. This position is responsible for review of tactical radios (TR), maintaining baseline (in coordination with TR engineers) of all TR installation technical drawings and serves as an expert providing technical guidance and information to meet requirements. **Must be a US Citizen** **This position is contingent upon contract award** **Sign-On Bonus Available** Essential Duties and Responsibilities Duties include, but not limited to : * Responsible for independently designing, modifying, and constructing electronic and electro-mechanical instrumentation used in performance measurements on test and evaluation projects. * Responsible for troubleshooting, installation, and maintenance of C4ISR equipment as appropriate for the task. * Performs fielding, installation, operations, test, preventive maintenance, troubleshooting, over the shoulder training, exercise and test support and maintenance. * Provides expert technical direction and guidance to subordinate technicians. * Plans and performs installation, test, preventive maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair for communications equipment, electronics equipment. Requirements Minimum Requirements Experience / Skills: * Hands-on or educational experience in two of the following core technical areas: electronics, network support (hardware/software), computers (hardware or software), tactical radios, satellite networks, data encryption, web-based apps, encryption devices, COMSEC, or Platforms * Minimum of ten (10) years of progressive experience in installing, planning and overseeing C5ISR systems on US Army vehicles. * Two (2) additional years of direct relevant technical experience may be substituted for education * Minimum of two (2) years experience installing the following tactical radios communications equipment: AN/VRC-119, AN/VRC-121, AN/VRC-116, AN/VRC-117, AN/VRC-124, AN/VRC-125, AN/VRC-126, AN/VRC-127, AN/VRC-132, and AN/VRC-135 Education: * AA degree or two-year technical school education in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or related scientific or technical discipline Other Qualifications: * U.S. citizenship is required. * DoD secret clearance is required. Special Note The position is contingent upon candidate's ability to meet physical and medical requirements as needed by the position; including compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local jurisdictional requirements. Government or customer site-specific requirements may include, but are not limited to, proof of full COVID-19 vac

Fallon, NV, United States Information System Security Officer (ISSO) with Security Clearance Fallon NV 89406 United States 2024-04-17 8340_7502678 ClearanceJobs No IT - Security Yes https://click.appcast.io/track/iay5u42?cs=i8d&jg=20ym&bid=q948nGl57dNhZO5Va2AQmA==Position Summary MAG Aerospace is seeking a Mid-level Information System Security Officer (ISSO) who will support mission training exercises in Fallon, NV. This is an on site opportunity. As an Information System Security Officer, you will be responsible forensuring the security and integrity of our organization's informationsystems. You will install, configure, and maintain our local area network(LAN), data communications network, operating systems, and physicaland virtual servers. You will perform system monitoring and verify theintegrity and availability of hardware, network, and server resources andsystems. Additionally, you will review system and application logs andverify completion of scheduled jobs, including system backups. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Duties include, but not limited to: * Install, configure, and maintain local area network (LAN), data communications network, operating systems, and physical and virtual servers * Perform system monitoring and verify the integrity and availability of hardware, network, and server resources and systems * Review system and application logs and verify completion of scheduled jobs, including system backups * Analyze network and server resource consumption and control user access * Install and upgrade software and maintain software licenses * Assist in network modeling, analysis, planning, and coordination between network and data communications hardware and software Requirements Minimum Requirements * 5 years of experience as ISSM or ISSO in a DoD environment * Experience in Information Assurance / Cybersecurity, including development, integration, and implementation of cybersecurity and program protection standards for networking, computers, and custom applications . * Thorough knowledge of the Department of Defense 8510.01 Risk Management Framework (RMF) for DoD Information Technology, DoD Instruction 8500.1 Cybersecurity, DoD Directive 8140.01, Cyberspace Workforce Management, NIST 800 Special Publications, Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), and knowledge of current authorization practices, particularly within the DoD. * Experience in creating and maintaining the security configuration baselines for Windows and Linux platforms, networking equipment, cloud technologies, and custom applications. * Must p ossess DoD Approved Baseline Certification as Information Assurance Manager Level II (i.e. CISSP, GSLC or CISM) Education * B.S. in Computer Science, Information System Management or equivalent degree program, from an ABET-accredited institution * An additional 10 years of relevant experience may be substituted for the degree Required Clearance * Active Top Secret Special Note The position is contingent upon candidate's ability to meet physical and medical requirements as needed by the position; including compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local jurisdictional requirements. Government or customer site-specific requirements may include, but are not limited to, proof of full COVID-19 vaccination status, except in circumstances where a candidate is legally entitled to an accommodation. Company Policy MAG Aerospace (MAG) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to Diversity and Inclusion. We encourage diverse candidates to apply to our positions.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Click below for the "Know Your Rights" and "Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination" supplement posters. https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters MAG Aerospace (MAG) is committed to providing an online application process that is accessible to all, including individuals with a disability, by offering an alternative way to apply for job openings. This alternative method is available for those who cannot otherwise complete the online application due to a disability or need for accommodation.

MAG Provides Reasonable Accommodation To Applicants Under The Guidance Of The Americans With Disabilities Act (ADA), Section 503 Of The Rehabilitation Act Of 1973, The Vietnam-Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act Of 1974, And Certain State And/or Local Laws. If You Need Assistance Due To a Disability, Please Contact The MAG Aerospace Recruiting Email:

or call (703) 376-8993. 0.00 1007957 On-site

Provides expert technical direction and guidance to subordinate technicians.
